result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian M Wilson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian M Wilson was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) dismiss dangerous weapon enhancer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Brian M Wilson was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: May be served through Interstate Compact with Kentucky.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the co-defendants.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

AS WELL AS $9,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND. Ct 1: 961.41(1)(h)2-Manuf/Del THC/use of dangerous weapon; Ct 2: 961.42(1)-Maintain Drug Trafficking Place; Ct 3: 961.41 PDP; Ct 4: 961.41(1m)(h)3-PCS/INTENT THC; Cts 5-7: 941.30(2): 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. No contact with the co-defendants.  No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney visits, confirmed and verified school and/or employment. Defendant must confirm and verify with ZCI all dates, times and locations PRIOR to leaving the house.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**Bond modified to allow defendant a 2 hour window, 2 days a week to take care of necessities. All dates, times and locations to be verified with ZCI.**

**AMENDED 11-17-2014:  GPS AND HOUSE ARREST CONDITIONS ARE REMOVED FROM BOND.**

for return / destruction of exhibits
Status conference on August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian M Wilson in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The State calls Officer Craig Klepel - DSAT. Direct by the State. Witness identifies Brian Wilson and Rebecca Teschler for the record. The witness identifies Charity Willenburg. Cross xam by Ms. Hall -defense for Brian Wilson. Defense marks Ex #1-RPD call detail report. Defense marks Ex #2-Officer Klepel's report. Defense marks Ex #3-affidavit for search warrant. Cross xam by Ms. Larsen - defense for Charity Willenburg. Cross xam by Mr. Kurzynski - defense for Nancy Ezell and Rebecca Teschler. Redirect by the State. Recross by Ms. Hall-defense for Mr. Wilson. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. The defense moves Ex #1-3 into evidence. The State objeccts to Ex #3. The Court allows exhibits 1-3 to be received. The State calls Officer Steve Diener - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Ms. Hall. Redirect by the State. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. The State has no further witnesses. Ms. Hall calls Brian Wilson - DSAT. Direct by Ms. Hall for the defense. Cross xam by the State. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. Mr. Kurzynski calls Nancy Ezell - DSAT. Direct by Mr. Kurzynski for the defense. Cross xam by the State. Direct by Ms. Hall - counsel for Mr. Wilson. Recross by the State. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. No further witnesses.

Argument by Ms. Hall. Argument by Ms. Larsen. Argument by Mr. Kurzynski. Argument by the State. Rebuttal by Ms. Hall.
Defense asks for deft to be allowed to go to the bank and take care of personal business.

BTC: The Court will take matters under advisement. Bond modification to remove ELM is denied.  Bond may be modified for Mr. Wilson to go to the bank and go to the gas station to get gas in the vehicle. All dates, times and locations to be verified with ZCI.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian M Wilson in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense does not believe the children were in danger and request that Cts 5, 6 & 7 be dismissed. Defense indicates that the State agrees to release cell phone and the State will contact RPD today. Defense asks that bond be modified to allow contact with this defendant and Ms. Teschler and that bail for both of these defendants be modified to signature bonds. The State objects to lifting the no contact order between this deft and Ms. Teschler and the children and leaves the issue of the amount of bond to the Court.

BTC: Motion to dismiss is denied. Motions must be filed by 6/1

Defendant Brian M Wilson in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Defendant Brian M Wilson in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense requests bail be modified to allow deft to return to school. Defendant was a full time student with a part time job in the evenings. Defense indicates deft is able to post $1,000.00 cash.
The State indicates that the co-deft had a reduction to a much lower cash bond, but the State feels that deft is more of a 'ring leader' and the pretrial screening indicates daily THC use.

BTC: Bond modification is granted. $1000.00 cash, $9000.00 signature bond. GPS/house arrest - release for court, atty visits, confirmed and verified school and/or employment. All other conditions remain as previously ordered.
